name: Flagship Footprint Flux
description: Major retail owners are repurposing or closing legacy footprint, creating opportunity windows for brand-led activations near flagship doors. That localized churn makes flagships testable labs for quick pop-ups and paid experiences that capture adjacent micro-communities.
operator_move: Have regional retail ops run a 6-week test with four flagships pairing local collab pop-ups and an exclusive SKU, and measure foot_traffic_uplift to +15% and QR_redemption >=5% by store; owner: regional retail ops, window: 6-week, KPI: foot_traffic_uplift and QR_redemption.
operator_scan: Measure baseline footfall then track incremental foot_traffic_uplift and QR scans during pop-ups.
spine_hook: Retail real estate is becoming activation windows.

name: Doorstep Micro-Communities
description: Underserved TikTok creator segments and local sneaker communities are actively recommending and buying sneaker finds, creating concentrated local audiences. Recruiting those creators into short residencies can shift early-window purchase share and lower event CPA versus broad influencer spends.
operator_move: Task brand partnerships and comms to recruit six local creators within a two-mile radius of one flagship for a 4-week residency, and target early_window_share 20-30% with event_cpa <=0.8x baseline; owner: brand partnerships + comms, window: 4-week, KPI: early_window_share and event_cpa.
operator_scan: Count creator-driven purchases and compare event CPA to baseline paid events.

name: Release-Driven Localization
description: Limited drops and raffles continue to gather physical queues and concentrated local audiences around stores. Those release events are an on-ramp to in-store experiences and measurable QR engagement if paired with reservation mechanics and near-door activation.
operator_move: Instruct store ops and product to run a 6-week limited drop pilot at two flagships with reserve-and-pickup plus an in-store activation, and measure foot_traffic_uplift (base 10-15%) and QR_redemption >=5%; owner: store ops + product, window: 6-week, KPI: foot_traffic_uplift and QR_redemption.
operator_scan: Track raffle entrants converting to purchases and QR scans at pickup.
spine_hook: Drops concentrate local demand at doorsteps.

name: Discounting Elasticity On Collabs
description: Holiday discount pressure can be reduced if collab-led in-store experiences convert local communities at higher yield than broad cut promotions. Running paired pilots that keep deeper discounts online but offer shallower, experience-backed incentives in-store will reveal the discount depth needed to hit margin and buyer-share targets.
operator_move: Direct finance and merchandising to run a 6-week paired pilot across three flagships comparing sitewide 30% discount to a 15% collab discount plus in-store experience, and measure buyer activity share vs promo intensity aiming to reduce promo depth by 10-15% while holding early_window_share >=20%; owner: finance + merchandising, window: 6-week, KPI: promo depth and early_window_share.
operator_scan: Track buyer activity share versus promo depth across pilot stores and channels.
spine_hook: Collab experiences change required promo depth.
